Definition: Given a phrase describing the relationship between two words, extract the words and the lexical relationship between them. The relation has to be of the type 'MemberOf', 'MadeOf', 'Synonym', 'Entails', 'HasA', 'HasProperty', 'PartOf', 'Antonym' or 'IsA'. The output should have the format: word1 relation word2.

Positive Examples.input: bed can be used as the opposite of bath
body can have or can contain bone

Instances.input: bed is part of human
book can have or can contain author
bed can be used as the opposite of chair
air can be used as the opposite of water
bowl can have or can contain liquid
bone is part of foot
bird can have or can contain baby
action is part of fight
bird can have or can contain tail
bowl is made of plastic
animal can be used as the opposite of bug
break can be used as the opposite of fix
baby can be used as the opposite of adult
box can be used with the same meaning of trunk
bed can be used as the opposite of bath
blow is part of fight
bird can be used as the opposite of mammal
bird can have or can contain body
build can be used with the same meaning of improve
bird can have or can contain tail
